rev.comment: The refs do not indicate he is a self avowed communist.
rev.diff:
Line 16: Line 16:
==Life and career==
==Life and career==
â
Trumka, born in [[Nemacolin, Pennsylvania]] near Pittsburgh, is an Italian-American,<ref>[http://www.osia.org/public/foundation/about-gala.asp Richard Trumka Awarded 2003 Sons of Italy Foundation Humanitarian Award]</ref> third-generation [[Polish American]], [[coal mining|coal miner]] son of Frank Richard and Eola Elizabeth (Bertugli) Trumka and self avowed [[Communist]].<ref name="WhosWho" /><ref name="Combative" /> He went to work in the [[Mining|mine]]s in 1968.<ref name="Combative" /> He received a [[bachelor of science]] degree from [[Pennsylvania State University]] in 1971 and a [[law degree]] from [[Villanova University]] in 1974.<ref name="WhosWho" /><ref>Jim McKay, "From Mines to Summit of Unionism," ''Pittsburgh Post-Gazette,'' October 23, 1995.</ref> He married Barbara Vidovich in 1982. They have one son.<ref name="WhosWho" /><ref>[http://www.nytimes.com/1982/11/28/us/around-the-nation-umw-chief-married-threat-upsets-schedule.html "U.M.W. Chief Married; Threat Upsets Schedule."] ''Associated Press.'' November 28, 1982.</ref>
+
Trumka, born in [[Nemacolin, Pennsylvania]] near Pittsburgh, is an Italian-American,<ref>[http://www.osia.org/public/foundation/about-gala.asp Richard Trumka Awarded 2003 Sons of Italy Foundation Humanitarian Award]</ref> third-generation [[Polish American]], [[coal mining|coal miner]] son of Frank Richard and Eola Elizabeth (Bertugli) Trumka. He went to work in the [[Mining|mine]]s in 1968.<ref name="Combative" /> He received a [[bachelor of science]] degree from [[Pennsylvania State University]] in 1971 and a [[law degree]] from [[Villanova University]] in 1974.<ref name="WhosWho" /><ref>Jim McKay, "From Mines to Summit of Unionism," ''Pittsburgh Post-Gazette,'' October 23, 1995.</ref> He married Barbara Vidovich in 1982. They have one son.<ref name="WhosWho" /><ref>[http://www.nytimes.com/1982/11/28/us/around-the-nation-umw-chief-married-threat-upsets-schedule.html "U.M.W. Chief Married; Threat Upsets Schedule."] ''Associated Press.'' November 28, 1982.</ref>
